item.title: Michaela add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "You're bound to get idears if you go thinkin' about stuff" -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Michaela add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "When a child first catches adults out -- when it first walks into his grave little head that adults do not always have divine intelligence, that their judgments are not always wise, their thinking true, their sentences just -- his world falls into panic desolation. The gods are fallen and all safety gone. And there is one sure thing about the fall of gods: they do not fall a little; they crash and shatter or sink deeply into green muck. It is a tedious job to build them up again; they never quite shine. And the child's world is never quite whole again. It is an aching kind of growing." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Michaela add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "So many old and lovely things are stored in the world's attic because we don't want them around us and we don't dare throw them out." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Michaela add a quote by John Steinbeck
item.description: "For it is my opinion that we enclose and celebrate the freaks of our nation and our civilization. Yellowstone National Park is no more representative of America than is Disneyland." -- John Steinbeck

item.title: Michaela add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "Friendship is born at that moment when one man says to another: "What! You too? I thought that no one but myself . . .&#34;" -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michaela add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "No book is really worth reading at the age of ten which is not equally – and often far more – worth reading at the age of fifty and beyond." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michaela add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "I'm on Aslan's side even if there isn't any Aslan to lead it. I'm going to live as like a Narnian as I can even if there isn't any Narnia." -- C.S. Lewis

item.title: Michaela add a quote by C.S. Lewis
item.description: "The task of the modern educator is not to cut down jungles, but to irrigate deserts." -- C.S. Lewis
